intro: Aspicarpa linearis, commonly known as the slender aspicarpa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Brazil and Paraguay. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and occur in clusters, making it somewhat distinct from other members of its family. Aspicarpa linearis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
